column5: My son and I made our annual trip to Sturgeon Lake we also fished Balsam a couple days . We went 16 for 53 my son caught the biggest at 48" on a top water lure . He also boated a couple Tiger Muskies the biggest was 46" and fat that was caught on a double10 . My biggest was a 44" er caught on Sturgeon . Tuesday was our slowest day only boated one and 2 follows it was bright cloudlest day no wind tought day . Enjoy the pictures if they upload .
That tiger musky is a phenomenal looking fish congrats
Beauty Tiger and good fishing.  Sound like you boys had a great time.
Beauty tiger!! I've never caught one! I'll assume that came out of Balsam, and not sturg?? You guys did awesome, thats a pile of musky!  S.
That tiger is just stunning!  Awsome job!
16 for 53 sounds like a steelhead report!  Good job, that's a lot of toothy critters.
Thanks guys. My son caught 2 Tigers on Balsam the other was mark nice to but was only 37" we also had a follow from a smaller one . It was a fun week and the time really went quick .

Sounds like you guys had an awesome trip. It makes me wonder why I always leave this area to go on a week long fishing trip. That is one spectacular looking Tiger, still haven't been able to put a notch on the belt buckle for myself.
That Tiger Musky is awesome!  Thanx for posting.
Nice looking fish there Hank!  Looks from the pictures like you had good weather too.  I wouldn't mind catching either of those big girls, I've been stuck in a sub 40" rut for a bit now.
Thanks for the report Hank!  Some really nice fish.  Glad you had a great trip.  Thanks also for all your help on my trip to Sturgeon
16 for 53 isn't your typical Muskie fishing stat. Sounds like an exciting trip. Amazing pic of that tiger. I'm jealous
some gorgeous fish and a great trip I'm sure. Maybe you mean 16 for 23 though? If not, may I suggest hooks on your lures
Amazing catches. Thinking of hitting Sturgeon next weekend. Last time we went in the summer it was crazy windy.
Amazing tiger for sure!!  Nice report man!
